intro: Schoenoplectiella annamica, commonly known as the Annam sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowering spikes. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
